CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicant took part in the cleaning up operation at the GPE nuclear disaster site .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Staryy ORG of LOC granted the applicant ’s action against ORG and awarded him and his family , comprising CARDINAL members , a flat in the town of PERSON and MONEY ( MONEY ) in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . The representative of ORG did not attend the hearing : in writing he had requested ORG to adjudicate the case in his absence .
CARDINAL . The judgment was not appealed against and became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Staryy ORG issued a writ of execution and enforcement proceedings were instituted .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged a statement of appeal against the judgment of DATE . The ORG also asked ORG to restore the DATE time - limit for lodging the appeal . The ORG claimed that it had received a copy of the judgment of DATE by fax on DATE . The ORG asked to stop the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . The applicant insisted that there had been no reason to restore the time - limit . He noted that a copy of the judgment had been forwarded to ORG at DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Staryy ORG restored the time - limit for lodging the appeal , accepted the ORG ’s statement of appeal and stopped the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG examined the ORG ’s appeal , quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh examination to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Staryy ORG , in the new examination of the case , accepted the applicant ’s action in part . The relevant part of the judgment read as follows :

“ Order that ORG should provide ... Mr Babynin G.A. and his family with housing LOC , which satisfy sanitary and technical requirements , in their turn according to the housing waiting list of families having persons with disabilities and individuals who had taken part in the cleaning operation at the site of the GPE nuclear plant .
Dismiss [ the claim ] for compensation for non - pecuniary damage . ”
CARDINAL . The judgment was not appealed against and became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE a writ of execution was issued and enforcement proceedings were instituted .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , from DATE a group of CARDINAL people , including the applicant , began a hunger strike to protest against the poor level of welfare protection provided for the GPE victims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the mayor of PERSON decided to provide the applicant with a flat measuring CARDINAL,CARDINAL ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received from the mayor an occupancy voucher in respect of the flat assigned to him . He found the flat satisfactory .
